page.title: 16LOCAL AMENITIES
page.content: There are a many local{churches;}St. Leonards and St.Marys at Wolborough, St.Marys at Abbotsbury are{C.of E.; also. Catholic, Methodist, Jehovah's. There is a{cemetery}with a chapel;this was originally a small collection of gypsy cemeteries but now caters for all denominations. Local{parks}include {Bakers}and{Powderham.}In Bakers Park activities include tennis, swings, slides, and football. Powderham Park being much smaller has no activities apart from swings and slides. The only {reservoir}in the area is{Roundways,} situated on a hill, where it gravity feeds Newton. The reservoir was finished in 1978, with reinforced concrete foundations. Its two compart- ments together hold{2,000,000 gallons of water,purified at Hennock and piped to Roundways. On average Newton Abbot uses{22,000 cubic metres}a week.
